resources:
Quiz Time! Scintillating Science Quiz Welcome to the Scintillating Science Quiz!!! A few rules before we begin: Rule 1. The Questions in this quiz are of three main types: free text response questions, checkbox questions(with one or more correct responses), and radio buttons(with only one correct response). Rule 2. Every correct response is awarded four points, and a wrong response results in the reduction of one mark, thus a maximum of 40 points can be scored on this quiz... Please note that blank responses are not penalized. Okay! Now let\'s get started!!!
----------------------------------- Q1. Quartz clocks contain quartz crystals, which are known in the world of chemistry as___________ Silicon dioxide Carbon dioxide Silica Silicon monoxide
------------------------------------ Q2. Name the only metal that exists as a liquid at normal room temperature. Enter your answer here... ----------------------------------------- Q3. Bronze is an alloy containing which of the following chemical elements? Tin Lead Copper Silver ---------------------------------------- Q4. Name the unit of measurement used for nuclear sizes. Fermi Angstrom Metres Centimeter ---------------------------------------- Q5. Name the scientist whose discovery is widely used to detect fractures and cracks in bones. (The scientist\'s surname is enough...) ---------------------------------------- Q6. Find the scalar quantities from the given options. Force Speed Velocity Pressure --------------------------------------- Q7. Pick the option that contains the number of chromosomes found in the nucleus of a normal human cell. 50 43 46 48 ---------------------------------------- Q8. The enzyme ptyalin is secreted in humans by this gland... Enter your answer here... ---------------------------------------- Q9. Presence of these in fish, prevent them from sinking (select all applicable options). A swim bladder Air filled lungs An air bladder Swimming floats --------------------------------------- Q10. The father of genetics, Gregor Mendel, performed his famous experiment on this plant... Enter your answer here... ---------------------------------------- Reset
---------------------------------------- submit evaluate
---------------------------------------- Your score is .. Congratulations!!!! .. That\'s an amazing score! .. Well done! .. That\'s okay! Better luck next time
